itemBody.p: Use the substitution method to solve these simultaneous equations.

If the equations have a single solution, enter the values of x and y below. Otherwise leave these input boxes empty.

p.feedbackInline: Please select one of the options above, then, if the equations have one solution, enter the values of x and y.

templateBlock.p: Using the substitution method, we can choose either of the equations as the one we use to obtain a value to substitute. We can also choose which variable to substitute for.
In this case, we choose equation () to obtain a value for y in terms of x.
Now substitute for x back into equation (1):
So the system of equations has one solution xy=iGiH
Now substitute for x back into equation (2):
Notice that the coefficient of x in equation (2) is times the coefficient of x in equation(1).
Also the coefficient of y in equation (2) is times the coefficient of y in equation(1).
On the right hand side, however, is not times .
So the lines defined by equation (1) and equation (2) are parallel and the equations have no solutions.
Notice that the coefficient of x in equation (2) is times the coefficient of x in equation(1).
Also the coefficient of y in equation (2) is times the coefficient of y in equation(1).
On the right hand side, is times .
So equation (2) is a multiple of equation (1) and the equations have infinitely many solutions because they are equations of the same line.

feedbackBlock.p: Substitute the value of x from one of the equations in the other equation to find the value of x, then substitute back for that value of x to find the corresponding value of y.
Since you have viewed the solution, your score for this question will be 0.
Since you have viewed the hint, your score for this question will be halved.
